<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>When asked by </span><span><em>60 Minutes</em></span><span> how long the economy will take to recover, Fed Chair Jerome Powell confirmed what we're all thinking: “</span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/fed-chairman-powell-tells-60-minutes-a-recovery-will-take-awhile-but-dont-bet-against-the-american-economy-2020-05-17?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">We really don’t know</a></span><span>.” He expects steady economic growth in the second half of the year barring no second wave of the virus, but warned getting back to full-strength will likely require a vaccine. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">International: </strong></span><span>Japan, the world's third-largest economy, has </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/17/business/japan-recession-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially entered a recession</a></span><span> (two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>This week, investors </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-weekahead/wall-street-week-ahead-investors-prepare-for-more-u-s-stock-swings-as-states-reopen-idUSKBN22R2WS?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be watching</a></span><span> rising U.S.-China tensions, progress in state reopening plans, and overall COVID-19 case counts. Stocks have been mostly treading water since the rally in April.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/detroits-big-three-automakers-resume-us-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Auto Plant Reopenings Not Fast, Not Furious
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Auto worker " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85ODUvYXV0b193b3JrZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jan Woitas/picture alliance via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...they are finally here. The big three Detroit automakers—GM, Ford, and Fiat Chrysler—are restarting production at many U.S. factories today. In total, roughly 133,000 auto employees will <a href="https://apnews.com/6eff35c0c71383df417ed015f7acf48d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">head back to work</a> by the end of this week, the AP estimates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some familiar caveats are in order:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The plants won’t be close to full production, so that 133,000 represents just over half of the pre-pandemic auto workforce.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM expects it’ll take at least a month to get back to full speed, while Ford hasn’t set out a timetable. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, there are concerns over worker safety. The companies have spent their quarantine working with the United Auto Workers union on plans to ensure employees can a) go back to work and b) not contract COVID-19. Expect staggered shift changes, yellow tape to mark social distancing, and temperature checks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This month, GM sent a care package to all of its U.S. employees with five face masks, instructions on returning, and a letter from CEO Mary Barra. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And here’s what Fiat Chrysler added to its break tables:</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85ODkvZmlhdF9jaHJ5c2xlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Fiat Chrysler</em> </small></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The auto industry: down but not out</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve been told not to do many things during this pandemic but driving a car isn’t one of them. So while the industry’s certainly been battered—total auto sales fell 21% from January through April—it appears to have escaped the fate of its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-17/emirates-said-to-consider-30-000-job-cuts-retire-a380s-faster?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">airline cousins</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In China, where the pandemic raged months before it arrived in the U.S., </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/a9e8b5a4-20c0-4286-8390-57412292221e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">demand for VW cars</a></span><span> has nearly returned to 2019 levels. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The dealer AutoNation reported </span><span><a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/car-sales-stocks-auto-parts-dealerships-light-trucks-51589464899?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased activity</a></span><span> recently. By the end of April, Texas sales were down only 5% year-over-year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>These plant reopenings will show us whether safe, large-scale manufacturing can be accomplished in the socially distant era. Michigan hopes so: More than a third of the state’s labor force has filed for unemployment benefits since March 15.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/buffett-drops-stake-goldman-sachs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who's Buying, Who's Selling?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re unsure whether to put money in the stock market or under your mattress, so are the world’s biggest investors.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s selling</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway shockingly sold <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/16/business/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-goldman-sachs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">84% of its stake</a> in Goldman Sachs in Q1, according to a new filing. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Berkshire funneled $5 billion into the bank when Wall Street was teetering in 2008.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But in this current crisis, Berkshire has soured on Goldman. It also recently dumped all of its holdings in U.S. airlines.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line, per Bloomberg’s Tara Lachapelle:</strong> “Buffett, 89, said proudly just two weeks ago that he thinks ‘nothing can stop America,’ but it’s getting <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-05-15/warren-buffett-sours-on-goldman-sachs-time-to-worry?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">harder to believe him</a>.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s buying</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-saudi-pif/saudi-wealth-fund-boosts-u-s-holdings-with-stakes-in-citi-boeing-facebook-idUSKBN22S0BQ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought the dip</a> in Q1, acquiring at least $7.7 billion worth of U.S. and European blue-chip stocks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Blue-chip = companies you’ve definitely heard of, including Facebook, Marriott, Disney, Starbucks, Citigroup, Boeing, and...Berkshire Hathaway. So meta. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The fund also </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/27/saudi-arabias-sovereign-wealth-fund-builds-500-million-stake-live-nation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scooped up stakes</a></span><span> in Carnival Corp and Live Nation, two companies that’ve been particularly pummeled by the coronavirus pandemic. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Saudi Arabia’s bullish on an economic recovery.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/jcpenney-files-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Penney Pincher
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JCPenney, the department store helping us find last-minute khakis for the band concert for 118 years, <a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/jc-penney-files-for-bankruptcy/578088/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for Chapter 11</a> bankruptcy protection Friday night. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company secured $900 million in bankruptcy financing. It'll get the first half in June, but it must meet requirements set by lenders by mid-July to get the rest—otherwise, it'll pursue a sale. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The plan for JCPenney:</strong></span><span> Reduce its store footprint, shave down $4.9 billion in debt, and potentially </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/16/bankrupted-jc-penney-plans-to-spin-properties-into-new-real-estate-company.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">split into two</a></span><span>: JCP the retailer and a real estate investment trust.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“This is absolutely about the coronavirus, this is about a governmental shutdown and about us all being in video chat for this,” an attorney from law firm Kirkland & Ellis said during a virtual court hearing this weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But many analysts think JCPenney’s path to Chapter 11 <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/why-jc-penney-j-crew-and-neiman-marcus-going-bankrupt-matters-120705290.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was inevitable</a>. The company has botched turnarounds, struggled to break its dependence on the shopping mall, and failed to innovate in the e-commerce era. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Macy’s, Brooks Brothers, or Belk could follow JCPenney into bankruptcy. And for all questions you might have about the b-word, we put together a quick and easy guide to bankruptcy. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/jcpenney-dead-brew-unpacks-bankruptcy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read more here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/many-new-yorkers-fled-city-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Maybe Connecticut Isn't So Boring After All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Polo in Connecticut" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85OTAvcG9sb19pbl9jb25uZWN0aWN1dC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tim Clayton/Corbis via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, the number of new apartment leases in Manhattan <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/15/manhattan-new-rentals-plunge-71percent-as-coronavirus-freezes-the-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 71%</a> to a decade-low of 1,407, according to a report from real estate firms Douglas Elliman and Miller Samuel. Vacancy rates also jumped to a 14-year high.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You can probably guess why. </strong>NYC has been the hardest-hit U.S. city, and COVID-19 restrictions have made it difficult for prospective tenants to tour apartments and commit to handing over their first born as a security deposit. Many of the city’s residents are expected to move out and find less crowded housing markets. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Friday, Connecticut Gov. Ned Lamont </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/15/gov-ned-lamont-people-could-move-from-new-york-city-to-connecticut.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> “phones are ringing off the hook at real estate offices” in the southern part of the state.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many New Yorkers have already hopped on the Merritt Parkway during the pandemic. And a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/16/nyregion/nyc-coronavirus-moving-leaving.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT analysis</a> of mail-forwarding requests showed a substantial spike in March and April to addresses outside NYC. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Popular locations include upstate New York, Long Island, southern CT, Miami/Fort Lauderdale, Philly, and D.C. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s a noticeable trend in who’s leaving. </strong>Most departures are from the city’s wealthier neighborhoods, especially the Upper East and West Sides of Manhattan. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Earnings (Target, Lowe’s, L Brands, Expedia)<strong style="color:#000"> </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Existing home sales; earnings (Best Buy, TJX, Medtronic, HPE); World Meditation Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Alibaba earnings; start to arrange barbecue menu, playlist, and cornhole tournament for Memorial Day weekend</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Borussia Dortmund's 19-year-old superstar Erling Haaland dances alone after scoring the Bundesliga's <a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/fist-bumps-masks-professional-soccer-returns-germany-112920707--sow.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first goal</a> in more than two months on Saturday. The German soccer league returned this weekend to empty stadiums, <a href="https://au.news.yahoo.com/sky-germany-attracts-record-audience-bundesliga-restart-123126879--spt.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big ratings</a>, and rules prohibiting players from pig-pile goal celebrations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elsewhere in the sports biz world...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NASCAR held its </span><span><a href="https://www.cbssports.com/nascar/news/nascar-cup-series-at-darlington-live-updates-as-jimmie-johnson-crashes-out-and-william-byron-wins-stage-1/live/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first race</a></span><span> since the pandemic began (spectator-less, of course). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>The Last</em></span><span> </span><span><em>Dance</em></span><span>, the 10-part documentary series about Michael Jordan, aired its two final episodes on ESPN last night. Also yesterday, a signed pair of sneakers Michael Jordan wore during his rookie season </span><span><a href="https://www.actionnetwork.com/general/michael-jordan-signed-shoes-record-breaking-sale?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold for $560,000</a></span><span> at auction.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Preakness Stakes, which would have taken place this Saturday, has been </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/horse-racing/story/_/id/29183944/preakness-rescheduled-oct-3-one-month-kentucky-derby?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moved</a></span><span> to Oct. 3—one month after the Kentucky Derby.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s already begun</strong>. A disruption of the $1.7 trillion art market isn’t just coming—it’s already here. And it’s making some people a lot of money: High-profile collectors are projected to rake in $900 billion by 2026. For the first time in history, you can be part of it with <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_5-18-2020&utm_term=Morning%20Brew%20Readers" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Masterworks</a>. Act fast and skip the 25,000-person <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_5-18-2020&utm_term=Morning%20Brew%20Readers" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">waitlist</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fam, we have some food info to feast on</strong>. Panera’s new <a href="https://delivery.panerabread.com/menu/category/12622?utm_medium=display-ad&utm_source=paid-digital&utm_campaign=family-feast&utm_content=morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Family Feast Value Meals</a> feed a family of four and start at $23. We’re talkin’ soups, salads, mac & cheeses, sandwiches, and chocolate chip cookies. Goodness gracious. <a href="https://delivery.panerabread.com/menu/category/12622?utm_medium=display-ad&utm_source=paid-digital&utm_campaign=family-feast&utm_content=morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Start feasting here</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Have a minute?</strong> Then take a minute to fill out this <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/CJ6IYV" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">super-short survey</a> for our brand partners who make this newsletter possible. Thanks! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Binge, then workout:</strong> </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Binge:</strong></span><span> </span><span><em>Avatar: The Last Airbender</em></span><span>, which is </span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/5/15/21259004/avatar-the-last-airbender-streaming-on-netflix-why-you-should-watch-series-guide" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">back on Netflix</a></span><span> as of Friday. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Workout: </strong></span><span>Brew writer Toby Howell wants to introduce you to the “</span><span><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20330747.47575/aHR0cHM6Ly9pbXBvc3NpYmxlaHEuY29tL2ZpdG5lc3MvYnJpbmctc2FsbHktdXAvP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/5d3c42dd283d8e25047adeeeB5234a505" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20330747.47575/aHR0cHM6Ly9pbXBvc3NpYmxlaHEuY29tL2ZpdG5lc3MvYnJpbmctc2FsbHktdXAvP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/5d3c42dd283d8e25047adeeeB5234a505&source=gmail&ust=1589814638854000&usg=AFQjCNEpVp6_MzDrpJnNOP8uvkqJ2aAvcw" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bring Sally Up</a></span><span>” challenge. In this workout set to the Moby song, “</span><span><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20330747.47575/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj02QTJWOUJ1ODBKNCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5d3c42dd283d8e25047adeeeE501e0a10" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20330747.47575/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj02QTJWOUJ1ODBKNCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5d3c42dd283d8e25047adeeeE501e0a10&source=gmail&ust=1589814638854000&usg=AFQjCNFWRXpKn5foz8w1U-__KNAZBhUH2Q" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Flower</a></span><span>,” the chorus instructs you to “Bring Sally up, and bring Sally down”...over and over again. You can choose any workout movement—he recommends squats, pushups, or planks—but when the song instructs you to “bring Sally up,” up is where you must go (and vice versa). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">*This is sponsored advertising content</sup></p>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen asked by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e60 Minutes\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e how long the economy will take to recover, Fed Chair Jerome Powell confirmed what we're all thinking: “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/fed-chairman-powell-tells-60-minutes-a-recovery-will-take-awhile-but-dont-bet-against-the-american-economy-2020-05-17?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWe really don’t know\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.” He expects steady economic growth in the second half of the year barring no second wave of the virus, but warned getting back to full-strength will likely require a vaccine. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInternational: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJapan, the world's third-largest economy, has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/17/business/japan-recession-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficially entered a recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis week, investors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-weekahead/wall-street-week-ahead-investors-prepare-for-more-u-s-stock-swings-as-states-reopen-idUSKBN22R2WS?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be watching\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e rising U.S.-China tensions, progress in state reopening plans, and overall COVID-19 case counts. Stocks have been mostly treading water since the rally in April.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/detroits-big-three-automakers-resume-us-production?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAuto Plant Reopenings Not Fast, Not Furious\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Auto worker \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85ODUvYXV0b193b3JrZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJan Woitas/picture alliance via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...they are finally here. The big three Detroit automakers—GM, Ford, and Fiat Chrysler—are restarting production at many U.S. factories today. In total, roughly 133,000 auto employees will \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/6eff35c0c71383df417ed015f7acf48d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehead back to work\u003c/a\u003e by the end of this week, the AP estimates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome familiar caveats are in order:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe plants won’t be close to full production, so that 133,000 represents just over half of the pre-pandemic auto workforce.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM expects it’ll take at least a month to get back to full speed, while Ford hasn’t set out a timetable. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, there are concerns over worker safety. The companies have spent their quarantine working with the United Auto Workers union on plans to ensure employees can a) go back to work and b) not contract COVID-19. Expect staggered shift changes, yellow tape to mark social distancing, and temperature checks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis month, GM sent a care package to all of its U.S. employees with five face masks, instructions on returning, and a letter from CEO Mary Barra. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd here’s what Fiat Chrysler added to its break tables:\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85ODkvZmlhdF9jaHJ5c2xlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eFiat Chrysler\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe auto industry: down but not out\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve been told not to do many things during this pandemic but driving a car isn’t one of them. So while the industry’s certainly been battered—total auto sales fell 21% from January through April—it appears to have escaped the fate of its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-17/emirates-said-to-consider-30-000-job-cuts-retire-a380s-faster?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eairline cousins\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn China, where the pandemic raged months before it arrived in the U.S., \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/a9e8b5a4-20c0-4286-8390-57412292221e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edemand for VW cars\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e has nearly returned to 2019 levels. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe dealer AutoNation reported \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/car-sales-stocks-auto-parts-dealerships-light-trucks-51589464899?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased activity\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e recently. By the end of April, Texas sales were down only 5% year-over-year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThese plant reopenings will show us whether safe, large-scale manufacturing can be accomplished in the socially distant era. Michigan hopes so: More than a third of the state’s labor force has filed for unemployment benefits since March 15.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e84% of its stake\u003c/a\u003e in Goldman Sachs in Q1, according to a new filing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBerkshire funneled $5 billion into the bank when Wall Street was teetering in 2008.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut in this current crisis, Berkshire has soured on Goldman. It also recently dumped all of its holdings in U.S. airlines.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line, per Bloomberg’s Tara Lachapelle:\u003c/strong\u003e “Buffett, 89, said proudly just two weeks ago that he thinks ‘nothing can stop America,’ but it’s getting \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-05-15/warren-buffett-sours-on-goldman-sachs-time-to-worry?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eharder to believe him\u003c/a\u003e.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho’s buying\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSaudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-saudi-pif/saudi-wealth-fund-boosts-u-s-holdings-with-stakes-in-citi-boeing-facebook-idUSKBN22S0BQ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebought the dip\u003c/a\u003e in Q1, acquiring at least $7.7 billion worth of U.S. and European blue-chip stocks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlue-chip = companies you’ve definitely heard of, including Facebook, Marriott, Disney, Starbucks, Citigroup, Boeing, and...Berkshire Hathaway. So meta. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe fund also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/27/saudi-arabias-sovereign-wealth-fund-builds-500-million-stake-live-nation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escooped up stakes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in Carnival Corp and Live Nation, two companies that’ve been particularly pummeled by the coronavirus pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSaudi Arabia’s bullish on an economic style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJCPenney, the department store helping us find last-minute khakis for the band concert for 118 years, \u003ca href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/jc-penney-files-for-bankruptcy/578088/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled for Chapter 11\u003c/a\u003e bankruptcy protection Friday night. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company secured $900 million in bankruptcy financing. It'll get the first half in June, but it must meet requirements set by lenders by mid-July to get the rest—otherwise, it'll pursue a sale. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe plan for JCPenney:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Reduce its store footprint, shave down $4.9 billion in debt, and potentially \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/16/bankrupted-jc-penney-plans-to-spin-properties-into-new-real-estate-company.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esplit into two\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: JCP the retailer and a real estate investment trust.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“This is absolutely about the coronavirus, this is about a governmental shutdown and about us all being in video chat for this,” an attorney from law firm Kirkland \u0026 Ellis said during a virtual court hearing this weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut many analysts think JCPenney’s path to Chapter 11 \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/why-jc-penney-j-crew-and-neiman-marcus-going-bankrupt-matters-120705290.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas inevitable\u003c/a\u003e. The company has botched turnarounds, struggled to break its dependence on the shopping mall, and failed to innovate in the e-commerce era. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMacy’s, Brooks Brothers, or Belk could follow JCPenney into bankruptcy. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85OTAvcG9sb19pbl9jb25uZWN0aWN1dC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTim Clayton/Corbis via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, the number of new apartment leases in Manhattan \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/15/manhattan-new-rentals-plunge-71percent-as-coronavirus-freezes-the-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 71%\u003c/a\u003e to a decade-low of 1,407, according to a report from real estate firms Douglas Elliman and Miller Samuel. Vacancy rates also jumped to a 14-year high.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou can probably guess why. \u003c/strong\u003eNYC has been the hardest-hit U.S. city, and COVID-19 restrictions have made it difficult for prospective tenants to tour apartments and commit to handing over their first born as a security deposit. Many of the city’s residents are expected to move out and find less crowded housing markets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn Friday, Connecticut Gov. Ned Lamont \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/15/gov-ned-lamont-people-could-move-from-new-york-city-to-connecticut.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “phones are ringing off the hook at real estate offices” in the southern part of the state.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany New Yorkers have already hopped on the Merritt Parkway during the pandemic. And a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/16/nyregion/nyc-coronavirus-moving-leaving.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT analysis\u003c/a\u003e of mail-forwarding requests showed a substantial spike in March and April to addresses outside NYC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePopular locations include upstate New York, Long Island, southern CT, Miami/Fort Lauderdale, Philly, and D.C. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s a noticeable trend in who’s leaving. \u003c/strong\u003eMost departures are from the
